inn1.comm: no swing and no bounce, left alone in the channel outside off
fuller ball, gets it to shape away slightly outside off, bordering on a wide, left alone
length ball, nipping back in at 126kph, punched from the crease towards mid-on
swinging in on leg, gets an inside edge on the flick to fine leg for the first runs of the day
nipping back in and sprayed down the leg side, Moor tries to tuck and makes no contact
beaten. That one just held up on a length. It was around the fifth or sixth-stump channel and Moor is guilty of sticking his bat out and the ball goes past  the outside edge to the wicketkeeper
tries to tuck to the leg side and gets rapped high on the pads

lovely cover drive for the first boundary of the match. Wide half-volley outside off. It swings away a little but that only gives Masakadza the opportunity to free his arms and crunch the drive through extra cover
good length ball on the stumps, defended down the pitch
fuller and on the stumps, defended back to the bowler
short of a length, swinging away outside off, Masakadza shoulders arms
sprayed down the leg side, Masakadza attempts to to glance and can't make contact
moving away late outside off, left alone
presses forward and defends this length ball close to the pad and into the off side
fuller and on the stumps, Moor knocks it back to the bowler
similar delivery, holding its line, punched firmly back to the bowler
length ball, this time it's nipping back in from outside off, Moor blocks into the covers region
angling in on middle and leg, tucked to square leg
stands tall to this length ball and punches it off the backfoot to covers
good length on off, holds its line, blocked off the front foot into the off side

picks out midwicket. A rather soft dismissal and the move to open with Moor does not pay off. It was good length ball and angling in on the pads. No real swing on that one and Moor fails to keep the tuck off the pads down, ends up offering catching practice to midwicket
moving away outside off, left alone
fuller and on the pads, pushes it between mid-on and midwicket and the ball is pulled back before the boundary
fired full and on the pads, clipped away to deep square leg, the fielder at deep backward square runs across and cuts it off
Lakmal cranks it up and bowls a good length ball at 140kph on the stumps, defends off the front foot and gets it slightly off the splice as the ball goes on the bounce to covers
runs it down to third man with an open bat face
short of a length and angling down leg, Musakanda fails to make contact on the attempted glance and it is called a wide
fuller and on the stumps, presents the full face of his bat and defends towards midwicket
tucked to deep backward square leg
fullish length around off, tries to drive with hard hands but leaves a big gap between bat and pad, just holds up in that channel and Musakanda gets beaten
short of a length and angling in, knocks it towards mid-on
back of a length and width outside off. It's delivered at just 127 clicks and Musakanda slaps it to the sweeper cover boundary

gets rapped on the pads with an inswinger. It was full and shaping in. Masakadza looks to attack and ends up walking into the shot and falls over as he misses the attempted on drive. The umpire takes little time to give it out. That looked plumb. Replays show that the ball would have clipped the inside of leg stump
short of a length outside off, Musakanda steers it to third man after sticking his bat out
jags back in sharply from a good length region and catches Ervine by surprise. He inside-edges the attempted tuck to fine leg and they take a brace
fuller and just outside off, Musakanda presents a straight bat and knocks it to mid-on
sprayed down the leg side, goes for the tuck and gets it off the pad as the ball rolls away towards square leg
good line and length. Full and angling across the left-hander from over the stumps, Ervine covers his stumps and lets it go

beaten! It was a smiliar angle but on the good length area this time. Gets it to angle across just enough to tempt the batsman to stick his bat out. Ervine does so and the ball goes to the wicketkeeper after missing the outside edge
jags back in sharply from a fullish length, Musakanda drops it just wide of mid-on and takes off for a quick single
tucked to backward square leg
full and angled across, shapes away late to take it further outside off

super delivery. Good length, moves away just a tad after landing and Ervine who is on the forward push does not account for it as the ball nearly kisses the outside edge on its way to the wicketkeeper
full and shaping away, left alone
overpitched outside off, no late away movement but enough width for Ervine to open up and crisply drive through extra cover
short of a length, blocked into the off side
shaping away from the right-hander, left alone outside off
jags back in from the good length region, does not find the middle of the bat as he prods forward and pushes it back to the bowler
length ball outside off, comes forward and pushes it into covers
good length, shaping away, goes after it and makes a weak attempt at gliding it down to third man. But he is nowhere near it and does not manage to make contact
good length ball, tucked to mid-on
presses forward to this fuller ball and pushes it into the off side
short of a length and nipping back in sharply, the angle takes it down the leg side and Musakanda can't put bat to ball as he tries to pull it behind square

heaved over mid-on and the ball goes on the bounce over the boundary. He is neither on the front foot nor on the backfoot but makes up for it with his good work with his hands. Sees the late inward movement and makes use of it to fetch it from outside off and loft it through long-on
runs it down to third man
fuller ball on off, comes forward and pushes it gently to mid-off
length ball, angled across, stays in the crease and waits for it before opening the bat face, picks out backward point
full and on the pads, nudged to midwicket
fuller and on the pads, clipped away to square leg
back of a length and width on offer, slapped hard but straight to point. The ball goes on the bounce to the fielder there and he jumps up to field it
short of a length outside off, waits for it and plays with soft hands this time as he places it wide of point to square third man

short ball at 132kph. Pulled from outside off between mid-on and midwicket. The outfield isn't too quick, probably because of the dampness. Mid-on gives it chase and just slips slightly as he pulls the ball back
comes forward to drive through covers and gets a thickish outside edge to third man
jumps up to ride the bounce on this short of a length ball and shuffles across to protect the off stump before dropping it into the off side
fuller around off, punched firmly off the front foot to short cover
pushed across on a fullish length, nudged to the leg side
flat length ball that goes the other way outside off. Ervine was playing for the turn and gets beaten
blocked into the off side off the front foot
tucked off the hips to midwicket and there is a yes-and-no as they think of a quick single. Ervines puts in a dive at the non-striker's end but a direct throw would have had him in trouble
tries to go over mid-on and gets beaten by the flight. Gets a leading edge and the ball goes in the air before landing in front of the fielder at long-off
flighted ball on the stumps, blocked off the front foot
fuller ball outside off, pokes at it half-heartedly as he looks to drive and gets beaten
short of a length ball, goes for the pull but there is not enough width and he ends up whipping it with a flat bat to mid-on
short and wide outside off, chops the cut to point

just about clears mid-on. He goes for the pull shot but the delivery is too full for the shot to come off. Does not get the desired elevation and the ball just about goes past the outstretched hands of the mid-on fielder who leaps in the air. The fielder at square leg runs across but the ball beats him as well
driven to deep extra cover off the front foot
fuller ball, driven firmly to short extra cover
tucked off the pads to midwicket
flighted, full and on the stumps, flicked wide of mid-on
nudges it to short fine leg. No run there
back of a length and spinning in on the leg stump channel tucked behind square, but there is a short fine leg in place and there is no run
on the stumps at a flatter trajectory, worked to square leg
full and outside off, presses forward and drives into the covers
pushed across the left-hander, on a fuller ball outside off, Ervine wristily whips it past midwicket
short and wide, slapped to sweeper cover
fuller and wide outside off, Musakanda waits for it and though it keeps a bit low, manages to open the face of his bat and steer it to third man
short ball, fetches the pull from outside off and hammers it to the cow corner region where the ball crosses the boundary on the bounce
back of a length, a lot closer to off this time and Ervine can't beat backward point on the slap
full and outside off, presses forward and pushes it between cover and point. The ball goes just wide of sweeper cover and they run hard for the second
pushed to mid-on off the front foot
slightly short and spinning away a little and Musakanda shifts back to go deep into the crease before nailing the pull through midwicket
full and on the pads, pushed down to long-on
nudged to square leg
pushed through quicker at a flatter trajectory. It's slightly short of a length and Musakanda punches it off the backfoot to the bowler
half-tracker down the leg side, pulled to short fine leg

chips the simplest of return catches and that is another soft dismissal. Wicket off the second ball for the legspinner. It was slightly short of a length and spinning in. Ervine tries to flick and closes the bat face early. Gets a leading edge for his troubles and the ball lobs straight back to the bowler who would have caught it in his sleep
tries to tuck to the leg side but gets it off the pads and the ball rolls to fine leg. Would have gone down leg so only a stifled appeal for lbw
loopy delivery outside off, presses forward and defends to point
tries to rush the batsman by pushing it through quicker on off, Raza manages to comfortably defend off the front foot back to the bowler
short and wide, cut to sweeper cover
flighted on leg, driven to extra cover
stays back and looks to tuck it to the leg side but ends up hitting it to his boot after it skids on and the ball lobs to the off side
takes a good stride forward to meet this length ball on leg and defends
length ball, straighter this time, comes forward and drops it in front of cover and thinks of the single as the non-striker takes off but decides against it and sends him back
very full ball, gets the bat down and drills it to midwicket
full and down the leg side, gets down to sweep and gets it to deep backward square leg

brilliant catch at the long-off fence but the fielder has unfortunately overstepped. It was full and outside off and Musakanda lofts it over mid-off with a flat bat. It was powerfully struck and though he gets six, Raza has a word with the debutant, probably trying to explain to him that it may not always be prudent to try and take on the fielder at long-off
gone next ball. Length ball, comes forward to defend and it's spinning away from him but he reaches out for it. Gets a healthy outside edge, first slip snaffles it
full and on the pads, clipped through midwicket
pushed wristily from outside off back to the bowler
flighted on the leg stump, it was the googly and Williams does not pick it. Plays for the turn and tries to flick it to the leg side and gets a leading edge
width outside off, cut square of the wicket
loopy full ball on the stumps, angling across from around the wicket, vlocked
slightly short of a length, stays on the backfoot and tucks it away to the leg side
full and outside off, driven to mid-off and Williams falls over as he completes the run

goes down for a sweep shot and gets rapped on the pads. Given by umpire Richard Illingworth but Raza has opted for a review. It pitched around leg and straightened. Question is if height will be an issue. No edge on that, so what remains to be seen is if the ball is hitting the stumps. It momentarily seemed like it may have pitched outside leg, which may have prompted Raza to go up for the review. But ball-tracking shows it's pitching on middle and leg and hitting the leg stump flush. That was a tricky call and a good decision in the end
pushed fuller on leg stump, driven to deep extra cover
fuller, pushed across on off, eased down to long-on
very full and on the stumps, clipped off the toes to deep backward square leg
gives it a lot of air wide outside off, Waller crunches a drive through covers and Suranga Lakmal at sweeper cover makes a poor effort. Dives but lets the ball get away from underneath him
width on offer outside off, brings out the cut but does not find the middle of the bat and chops it towards point
fired down the leg side, quite a distance away from the leg stump, in fact
pitched up, driven down to long-on
gives it too much air and ends up bowling a full toss that is swatted by Waller. Ends up going too hard at it and gets it off the inside part of the bat and on the bounce to the right of the bowler
leans across and drives away to sweeper cover
fuller and angling in on middle and leg, pushed off the front foot to covers
length ball, angling in on middle and straightening, beats the outside edge of Waller who is stuck in the crease and sticks his bat out
driven through covers
waits for it in the crease before steering it away to deep point
shifts back and tucks it to square leg
full and outside off, drilled off the front foot straight back to the bowler
very full outside off, driven very hard but can't beat extra cover
gives it too much air outside off and bowls a full toss that is heaved over extra cover and the ball beats the man at sweeper cover who runs across and goes on the bounce over the boundary
tossed up outside off, driven to sweeper cover
spinning in from a length outside off, blocked from the crease
very full and on the pads, clipped off the toes to short fine leg
looks to stay back and tuck to the leg side but gets a mild leading edge to the off side

miscued slog that is taken by the bowler. Needless shot from Waller. Looks to go against the turn as he looks to blast this one over the leg side against the turn. Gets a leading edge for his troubles and skies it straight down the ground. It stays in the air forever but Pathirana calls for the catch and settles under it to take it without fuss
fuller ball, eased down to long-on
full and angling in on middle and leg, pushed past the left of the bowler who dives but can't get his hands to it and the ball goes to long-off
tossed up on the stumps, clipped away to square leg
waits for it before tucking off the pads to square leg
pitched up outside off, whipped away to long-on
tucked off the pads to short fine leg
nudges off the pads to deep midwicket
checks the front foot push and the ball goes in the air but lands short of short cover
width on offer outside off, slaps it away to sweeper cover
pitched right up on the stumps, Waller knocks it to mid-on
just some width outside off, slashes at it and gets it off the splice to third man
good length on off, defended off the backfoot
fuller ball, angled across outside off, Williams leans forward and eases into a push that goes to short cover
short of a length outside off, Williams stands tall and punches off the backfoot towards mid-off, short cover runs across and cuts it off
good length around off, puts his head down and defends off the front foot into the off side
angled across and offers up some width outside off, Williams uses his wrists to ease it away to sweeper cover with an open bat face
floats it up too much and offers up a full toss that is turned away to deep midwicket
good length, draws the batsman forward and beats him after getting it to spin away sharply, misses the off-stump as well narrowly
flighted on off, eased to mid-off off the front foot
fuller outside off, driven away to long-off
flat and short of a length, pulled away to deep square leg
googly on leg stump channel, hurried him with pace as well and Cremer fails to make contact with the attempted tuck as the ball brushes the pad and goes away to the off side
bowls it full and on the toes, clipped away through midwicket
short ball, pulled towards fine leg, does not get too much power on the shot as there was not enough room and that enables the fielder at deep backward square leg to run forward and field it
good length ball, fends it off to covers
good length, tries to tuck it to the leg side but is late in closing the face of his bat and ends up knocking it back to the bowler
defended off the front foot into the off side
good length outside off, presses forward and pushes it through covers
pre-meditated. Gets down to scoop this early and ends up getting a favourable full ball, gets it away towards short fine leg
short of a length, tucked off the hips to deep backward square leg

good, wide yorker, Cremer slashes and can't make any contact. Seems like the foot came off and Dickwella is excited after taking the bails off. It can't be a run out as the batsman wasn't that far out
short and wide, slapped away to sweeper cover. They think of the second momentarily but Lakmal tidies up and fires in a throw
pitched up outside off, driven wide of mid-off
poor shot selection. Goes for a lap sweep to a back of a length ball that is spinning away outside off, can't make contact

googly from Vandersay. It was full and on off and middle and Cremer was forward looking to flick it away. The ball goes past the inside edge and gets rapped. The umpire says not out but they opt for a review. There was not much gap between bat and pad and he may have got an inside edge on it. Very, very tight and the third umpire takes all of eternity to be sure of that. Eventually decides, after countless replays and angles. There is no conclusive evidence to overturn the on-field umpire's decision and Jeremiah Matibiri's call stays
very full ball, squeezed out off the front foot to the right of the fielder at extra cover who dives but can't stop it
off-cutter on a fullish length. Gets it to turn slightly line an off-break, pushed off the front foot into the off side
very full ball, Williams jams his bat down and squeezes it out to covers
punched off the backfoot to long-off
wristily turns it away from outside off to long-on
pushed through at 82kph, blocked off the front foot into the off side
tossed up and fuller, pushed to covers off the front foot

good catch at extra cover. And credit to the bowler too for taking pace off the ball and tossing it up, inviting the drive. Cremer drives and does so uppishly and Kusal Mendis times him jump to perfection to snaffle it. That may have stopped on him a bit
comes forward to defend but does not pick that it's a googly. Appeal for lbw but not given. But maybe it would have missed leg
tucked off the pads and the ball goes to deep fine leg where it is pulled back just before the boundary
fuller ball, clipped to deep midwicket
short ball, pulled to deep square leg
beaten on the drive. It was an off-cutter and Tiripano chased after it leaving a big gap between bat and pad
pitched up ball, drilled back to the bolwer

full and outside off, pushed back towards the bowler who gets down but cannot pick it up. Mid-off runs across and responds with a one-handed pick-up s the batsmen try a single off the misfield. Direct hit at the non-striker's  end would have seen the back of Tiripano
punched off the backfoot to the bowler
pitched up on the stumps, eased down to long-off
blocked down the pitch off the front foot
gets a stride across to meet the pitch of this fuller ball outside off and wristily drills it to the left of the bowler who fields it
tucked with the spin to backward square leg
short and spinning away. Tiripano deliberately opens the face of his bat late and gets it wide of first slip towards third man
flighted and pitched up on middle, defended off the front foot towards mid-off. The bowler runs back and fields it
fuller outside off, presses forward to meet the pitch of the ball before easing a drive between extra cover and long-off
punched to sweeper cover
short of a length, punched off the backfoot straight back to the bowler
full outside off, comes forward to drive and the ball goes off the inside part of the bat to midwicket
stays back and tries to tuck behind square but finds short fine leg
short of a length, looks to hang back and tuck to the leg side. It was an off-cutter and spins back in sharply to rap Tiripano on the pads. The turn would have taken it down leg
knocks it uppishly to midwicket but the ball drops in front of him
steered to backward point
flighted on the stumps, blocked off the front foot into the off side
pitched up and drawing the batsman forward before getting it to spin away sharply, defended
slightly back of a length and spinning away, punched to long-off
tossed up on leg stump but gives it too much air. Williams accepts the low full toss, gets down and sweeps to deep backward square leg
tucked to deep square leg
gets the front foot inside the line of the ballas he comes forward and defends
driven to long-off and they jog trough the single
short of a length outside off, shuffles across and tucks it to midwicket
fullish and on off, blocked
short of a length, sees a little bit of width and flays it with a flat bat, can't beat short cover

another slog sweep gone awry. Williams gets down and goes across the line of this fuller ball. Skews it off the leading edge to cover where Dhananjaya de Silva pouches it comfortably. That was he off-cutter and Williams did not account for the turn
good length outside off, gets an inside edge on the front foot defence and the ball goes to the leg side
fuller and on the stumps, pushed gently back to the bowler

fuller ball, driven uppishly to the left of the bowler but it was struck extremely hard and the ball shoots past the bowler by the time he can get his hands around it. Beats mid-on even more comfortably
fuller ball, driven straight to mid-on this time
short of a length outside off, stays in the crease and waits for it before dropping it in front of point
fuller ball, attacking the stumps, clipped off the toes to deep midwicket

nicked behind. It was an off-cutter that just left him a little bit. On a length and Chisoro was forward and sticking his bat out. The blade turns just as the ball takes the outside edge and the wicketkeeper, standing up to the stumps, snaffles it. So no heroics from Chisoro this time
gets this to nip away from the length area on middle, bunted to the off side

appeal for lbw and that's the end of that. This was a full toss that should have been smacked over deep midwicket, but he was too early into what looked an ungainly heave. Missed it completely and the ball hit him dead in front of leg stump. As an umpire you can't ask for a simpler decision than that.

inn2.comm: sprayed down the leg side and called a wide

fuller ball, De Silva looks to flick to the leg side but the ball swings back in and raps him on the pad. But the question is if it has swung back in enough to take the ball past leg. Doesn't seem like, at least after initial looks at the replay. There is certainly no bat involved. Ball-tracking shows three reds. The ball would have crashed into middle and leg. So early breakthrough for Zimbabwe, just what they needed in defence of a small total
walks into the shot before pushing awkwardly to covers. Needs to be careful, could have chipped that in the air
little bit of away-swing from the fullish length, Dickwella presses forward and eases it through coves to get off the mark

outside edge that flies past the slip cordon to the third man boundary. That was pacy, 140kph, very low full toss and swinging away, Perera looks to to go through the off side and the edge goes between the two slips and gully
full and outside off, driven to cover

whacked over mid-on. Perera is not one to curb his attacking instincts no matter what the conditions are. This one was pitched up and there for the taking. Perera lofts it over mid-on but the outfield is extremely sluggish and the ball barely carries, so it is pulled back easily
down the leg side, Dickwella looks to flick and the ball goes to the wicketkeeper. Appeal for caught behind but not given. It must have brushed the pad because there is no wide signalled
knocks it to mid-on

short of a length ball, Dickwella picks it up and pulls through midwicket. Does not really get hold of the shot but it's well over the fielder at midwicket. Thinks momentarily of the third but they decide against it. Seems like Sri Lanka are in a hurry here
fuller ball, pushed across, Dickwella strides forward and pushes it square of the wicket for a brace
full and angled away outside off, driven to cover
full and on the pads, clipped hard to deep square leg
fuller ball at 131 clicks on the stumps, knocked to mid-on
can't be bowling there. Full and angling on leg stumps, all Dickwella has to do is put bat to ball which he does to glance the ball fine for a boundary
sprayed on the pads again, clipped to deep backward square leg, there is a man around that region, so it will be cut off this time
fuller ball, gets it off the inside part of the bat on the front foot push as the ball goes to deep midwicket
good length on off, stays in the crease and punches with a closed bat face to midwicket
full and on the stumps, blocked back to the bowler
short ball, Dickwella rolls his wrists over the pull shot to control it as the ball goes to midwicket

full and angled across. Enough room to free his arms and he can get to it easily given the fullish length. Heaves it over mid-off and this time he gets enough bat on it for the ball to go all the way to the boundary
full ball outside off, gets an outside edge to third man
fuller and wide outside off, Perera slashes and drills it to covers
width on offer outside off, Perera goes after it with hard hands and flays it wide of backward point as the ball goes to the square third man boundary
full and outside off, drills it to mid-on with a closed face of the bat
punched off the backfoot to backward point

gone through Dickwella's defence. Beats him with pace. It was full and there is a bit of late movement in. Dickwella pushes half-heartedly forward and ends up leaving a gap between bat and pad through which the ball sneaks through and takes out off and leg stumps
great delivery first-up. Full and angling away in that corridor of uncertainty. Mendis is equal to the task and lets it go
straying down leg, Mendis tries to tuck off the pads but wears it on the thigh guard and the ball goes towards the deep fine leg fence

outside edge, not taken. It was full and wide and Mendis slashes hard at it as he looks to drive. Gets a healthy outside edge and the ball goes between wicketkeeper and first slip. Seems like the keeper left it for first slip to take and the fielder at slip wasn't ready for it assuming it was the keeper's catch. But that was definitely catchable for Moor
full and wide, Mendis again has to reach out for it but this time makes superb connection. Gets it bang off the middle and the ball races away square of the wicket on the off side
short and wide, slapped to cover-point who fumbles
nudged to short fine leg
fuller ball, pushed through quicker, driven to long-off
looks to run it down to third man by opening the face of his bat and gets beaten
nudged to square leg
full and tossed up wide outside off, tries to entice the batsman forward but Mendis lets it go

chance at mid-on, taken. Can't understand this approach by Sri Lanka. It was a length ball just outside off and Perera looks to slog it across the line. Ends up skewing it and skies it to mid-on where Waller catches it easily. Just minutes to go for lunch and they lose another wicket
gets an inside edge on the front foot defence to this fuller ball and gets it to deep square leg
fuller ball, comes forward and pushes, ends up chipping it slightly but gets it on the bounce to mid-off. Wonder if that one stopped on the surface a little bit
full and outside off, driven hard square of the wicket but straight to point
good length outside off, comes forward and defends, gets it off the splice square of the wicket. The fielder at point dives but the ball gets past him
good length ball, defended into the off side
slider back into middle from around the stumps, cut to point
drifting into the pads, turned to deep square leg as they jog the single
pushed through quicker outside off, this one skids on, left alone
worked with the spin to Cremer at midwicket
too full outside off, dabbed to short third man
slides one across the batsman from around the stumps, eased wide of cover
slips in a yorker-length delivery on middle and leg, Tharanga gets a thick inside edge down to fine leg. Was late to jam his bat down but no damage done this time
drives a low full toss on off to mid-off
gets this to nip away from middle. There was an invitation to drive as well, but Kusal pulled out at the last moment
thumped down the ground past mid-off. The fielder didn't bother moving. Too full and it got the treatment it deserved. Superb follow-through, terrific balance. Delightful to say the least
flicked into the gap between midwicket and mid-on. This time it was a legstump half-volley and he put that away with an air of disdain
this is an excellent leave, once again at drivable length
short down leg, tickled to short fine leg
slow turn back into middle and leg, tucked to midwicket
nurdled into the vacant square leg region as they scamper a single
checks his drive as the ball stops on him just a touch. It was a hard jab that nearly lobbed to cover
slides back in and kicks off from the rough patch to hit him on the glove as he looks to tuck it towards short fine
stretches forward and deadbats that quicker delivery on middle
late movement back in from wide of the crease, Tharanga drives and gets a thick inside edge to midwicket
width and he slashes, gets a thick edge that flies to the right of gully, and down to third man
crunching cover drive but straight to the fielder. This was hit superbly on the up
gets this to jag away off the seam from the length area on middle, left alone
looks to split cover and mid-off, ends up hitting it to cover point. Went too hard on the drive and the bat face turned in his hand

he still manages to pierce the off side ring. That's a bullet drive that beat both men inside the ring before they could move. What timing, what placement. He's pint-sized but boy, can he pack a punch or what?
slow turn from well outside leg, easy call for the umpire. PJ Moor fumbles and half-stops it
struck on the pad as he prods forward but the impact was outside the line of the stumps
worked wide of the bowler to long-on as they jog the single
firm push with the spin to long-off. Too easy at the moment
spins back in to hit him on the pad as he goes back to defend
trifle short on middle and leg, whipped to square leg
gets the direction wrong again. Fired in but down leg side, good stop by the keeper
gets to the pitch of the ball and laces it to mid-off
this one's a length ball that moves away from middle, Kusal is solidly behind the line of the ball in defence
superb stop at point. Williams throws himself to his right to effect a one-handed stop
stays inside the crease and dabs it to point
gets forward and pushes a full-delivery angling away towards cover
top effort from Williams, this time he throws himself to his left. Was a certain boundary if not for the dive.

he can't finish with a maiden. This is a half-volley that he'll put away nine times out of ten. How beautiful he looks while playing it? Plants forward, gets to the pitch of the ball and crashes it authoritatively between cover and mid-off
fuller ball, driven wide of mid-off
full and on the stumps, pushed to mid-on
beaten outside off. It's flat and full, Mendis comes forward but the ball spins past him and bounces sharply as it goes to the wicketkeeper
driven to long-off
pushed fuller and wide outside off, Mendis strides forward and pushes to mid-off
comes forward to defend and gets it off the inside edge to square leg
worked with the spin to long-on
fired down the leg side, the batsman looks to sweep but couldn't get any bat on it. PJ Moor does well to dive and stop it
eased back to the bowler with the spin
low full toss that has been thumped into the gap at extra cover
this is short and angling away, he rocks back and cracks that between cover and point. A tag-team effort keeps it down to two

Williams is disgusted with that effort from Musakanda. Tharanga got a thick inside-edge on the drive that rolled towards the fielder, who ran in quickly from long-on but took his eye off the ball and let it through his legs
touch of width this time, pushed wide of cover
tossed up outside off, Tharanga gets across and drives to deep cover
gets a good stride forward and stabs it to the off side
gift of a delivery that has been powerfully swept into the deep square leg boundary. Can't bowl full tosses with these many to defend
reaches out and crashes the drive to sweeper cover
drilled back to the bowler, excellent stop on his followthrough. Didn't have much time to react
fired into middle and leg, he stays inside the crease and blocks
driven firmly with the spin to wide mid-off
lunges forward and deadbats that in-drifter
quicker one on the pads, this one spins away a touch and Kusal gets a leading edge that rolls to the off side
eased with the spin to cover
this is a quicker one on middle from wide of the crease, he gets forward and defends
commits himself to the frontfoot again, does well to keep that out again
tumbling effort from Raza at extra cover. That was driven firmly
doesn't get underneath the flight, squeezes that full ball to mid-off
spins back in from outside off, turned with the spin to the man at short leg
wrong'un, he read it late. But adjusted well by going back into the crease and then defend

gets a leading edge that lobs over the bowler's head. Lucky break. Turned the bat face too early, the ball got him on the top part of the bat. Bounce did the trick but Cremer perhaps didn't realise the ball had lobbed over him until it landed
firm push but straight to cover
fired down leg and he's powered the sweep into the deep backward square leg boundary. Just got down on one knee and swatted it away without much fuss
pushed back to the bowler
rocks back and eases the short ball to point
fires a full ball on off stump from wide of the crease, squeezed to cover
slow turn from off stump, he lunges forward and defends
plays back to a delivery he could have well prodded forward, tapped without much harm in the end. Could have been risky had the ball skid back in
another leading edge, this time the ball lands short of where a short cover fielder would have been. He went across the stumps to work it off his hip but the ball rushed onto him
gets into a tangle as he looks to pull, got a thick inside edge onto the pad as he overbalanced
worked with the spin to midwicket
this is a slider across the batsman, Tharanga stabs forward and blocks
gone through him! Superb googly which Tharanga had no clue about. Played outside the line of that delivery that skid on to beat the inside edge.
gets back into the crease and works it to midwicket
tossed up on off, he gets forward and blocks
steps out and drives it back to the bowler
gets underneath the flight and defends
slider on middle and leg, worked wide of short fine leg as they jog the single
drives but it's hit off the toe end, straight to mid-off
gets forward and dabs the full delivery back to the bowler
plays the short-arm jab well, but straight to midwicket
driven with the spin to wide long-off, sensible cricket this
gets across to work that across the line but ends up whipping it back to the bowler
gets forward and just a touch outside the line of the stumps and blocks
short, he swivels back and pulls it all along the ground to deep square
crashing drive but straight to the sweeper cover fielder
slides a quicker delivery on leg stump, swept to deep fine leg
closes the bat face too early, the ball holds up and then goes straight on to take a leading edge that rolls to the off side
stretches forward and turns it with the spin to the leg side
cuts and nearly pays the price. This one spins back in sharply to rap him on the glove. Played well outside the line. At the moment, Tharanga is looking clueless against Williams and Cremer

Masakadza has put down a tough chance at shortmidwicket. . This was chipped with the spin, he did well to put his hand out and get to the ball but couldn't hold on. Catches like those stick. Full marks for the effort though
eased with the spin to cover
drilled back to the bowler with the spin
goes back into the crease and works that slightly-fuller delivery from middle to short leg. Risky
pushes it off the front foot and sets off for the run. Tiripano does well, but Tharanga did a full-stretch and grounded his bat all along to comfortably finish the run
gets forward and across and defends that late with the spin
too full, makes a bit of room and goes inside-out towards wide long-off
this is a wrong'un but he gets across, reads it early, and then defends it back down the pitch

picks the vacant extra cover region. It was pitched up outside off and Mendis comes forward to meet the pitch of the ball before driving uppishly through extra cover. Two fielders converge in on the ball in the deep but it beats both
works it square of the wicket on the off side to turn the strike over
short ball, swivels around with the pull to square leg where a diving stop is made
defended to short midwicket
pushed across on a fuller length outside off, pushed gently off the front foot
shaort and wide, slaps but backward point darts across to his left in a jiffy and cuts it off

gives it too much air on the leg stump channel and ends up firing a full toss that dips on Mendis. But the batsman gets low and sweeps it to deep backward square leg and soaks in the applause from the dressing room as he raises his fifty
driven to long-off
flat and full outside off, Tharanga uses his wrists to knock it to short midwicket
defended off the front foot into the off side
tucked to midwicket
width on offer outside off, Tharanga hangs back and opens the face of his bat to steer it towards third man. They gather three by the time the ball can be pulled back
good length on off, defended off the front foot into the off side
full and outside off, Tharanga sticks his bat out at the wide delivery and eases it through covers to the left of sweeper cover
short of a length on the stumps, kept out to the leg side from the crease
fuller ball, Mendis presses forward and crunches a drive through covers, but Sean Williams makes a brilliant save, diving to his right, in covers. Saved a certain boundary there
good length on off, Mendis strides across and punches through the off side, mid-off runs across to the left to stop it
just a tad wide outside off, Tharanga steers it straight to short third man. He tried to go a bit too hard there, so it may have affected the placement
short ball, Mendis pulls it over the outstretched hands of the leaping midwicket fielder and deep square leg runs across and cuts it off before the boundary
full ball, eases it to mid-on

that's a brilliant catch at deep square leg. Take a bow, Sean Williams! Mendis got down to slog sweep this fuller ball and got a top-edge on it. Williams backtracks a bit and times his jump to perfection as he snaffles it with his fingers pointing towards the sky. He had the sun right in his face but has plucked a stunner. They go upstairs to check is his foot touched the rope but he has is fine by a good margin
pitched up on middle and leg, pushed to mid-on
pitched up on leg, clipped off the toes to the right of mid-on who runs across and fields it in the midwicket area
Tharanga takes a good stride across to cover his off-stump before dabbing this ball down the pitch, to the left of the bowler
good length ball, angling across, defended
fuller ball, pushed to mid-on
full toss on off, Gunaratne leans forward and creams a drive to the sweeper cover fence
good length on the stumps, defended to covers off the front foot
fuller ball on off, driven to mid-off

fuller ball, tucked off the pads to deep square leg, the fielder at deep backward square leg jogs through and is a bit slow in gathering the ball, they take him on for the third run and though the fielder fires in a throw at the striker's end, they manage to finish the run
pitched up ball, clips it to the left of short leg who gets down and puts a hand to it
defended back towards the bowler
full and on the stumps, driven with the turn through extra cover
floated up on off, pushed past mid-off
rocks back as he shapes up to play a cut shot to this short and wide ball but another brilliant save at point
short of a length, swats a pull to midwicket but does not get hold of it
fuller and outside off, turned away to mid-on who is slightly deep
given a lot of air and dipping in late on the leg stump channel, pushed firmly back to the bowler
loopy flighted ball that is a tad straighter this time, driven to long-off
short of a length ball, tucked off the pads to midwicket
full and outside off, driven firmly but straight to short cover
flighted and pitched up outside off, driven square of the wicket where it goes straight to point
defended off the front foot down the pitch

waits for it before backing away to make room for himself and steering it towards third man. Malcolm Waller runs back and slides in to pull it back just before the ropes. They go upstairs to check for contact with the ropes but he has done well there
pitched up of off, turns it away to midwicket
hangs back and steers this one towards backward point
makes use of the room as it spins away sharply after landing on a short of a length and slaps it away to sweeper cover
flat and wide short of a length ball outside off, chops the cut shot
drifting into middle and leg, tucked wide of short midwicket
tries to push it quicket and ends up bowling it short, Tharanga mistimes the cut to point
waits for this wider ball and steers it to point
pitched up outside off, Tharanga comes forward and punches it to cvoers
stays back and tucks this length ball to midwicket
turned away to midwicket
pitched up ball, clipped to midwicket
gives it just a tad little air and bowls it full on leg stump, turned away behind square
defends without feet and gets it off the splice towards point
length ball, blocked off the front foot into the off side
slashes hard and drives square of the wicket, just to the left of point
short of a length ball, width on offer outside off, slapped through point
lovely shot. Loopy fuller ball that is drifting on off after being pushed across from around the wicket, Tharanga presses forward and creams it through extra cover

make that three in three. Overcompensates after overpitching the previous one and drops it too short. THaranga swivels around with the pull and sends it to the deep backward square leg boundary. The Sri Lanka captain finally getting a move on
comes forward and drives to short cover, does not get hold of it
comes forward to defend and gets it off the splice to midwicket
drifting in on leg with the arm, pushed to mid-on
driven to cover
width on offer outside off but it keeps low and Tharanga can't middle the cut, picks out short extra cover
length ball, drops it in front of point with an open bat face. Gunaratne wants the single but Tharanga sends him back
opens the face of his bat, not enough room and picks out point
defended to the off side
a tad wide outside off, cut away to sweeper cover
comes down the track and knocks it to the right of the bowler
short of a length ball, spinning in sharply, knocks it back to the bowler
tucked off the pads to square leg
goes for a slog sweep and gets hit on the pad. Impact outside off
some intent from Tharanga. Makes use of the feet and comes to the pitch of the ball. Lifts it just to the left of the man at mid-on who makes a good effort and dives. But he times and places it well

another lofted stroke and over the mid-on region again. Does not time it too well and does not get hold of it but it beats the man there nonetheless. The ball does not carry all the way to the boundary
comes down the track but the bowler does well to adjust his length, Tharanga blocks
fuller ball on the stumps, Tharanga flays it through midwicket for his half-century. Seems to be in a hurry now to finish it. That's also his half-century
and a clean, straight six to seal the game and the title. Comes down the track to meet the pitch of the ball before lofting it straight over the bowler's head for a clean six
